main event: On March 8th, 1948, a male civilian in Bakersfield, California observed two objects falling to the earth, one of which seemed to be on fire with red and black smoke trailing behind.
interesting points: The observation was made by a male civilian employed by the Pacific General Electric Company.
Two objects falling from an unknown source with smoke and debris trailing were sighted on March 5th, 1948.
Observations were made in the Bakersfield area, one sighting being southwest toward Buena Vista Lake.
Several incident summaries were forwarded for study and recommendation in regard to the involvement of weather balloons.
The report includes a checklist for unidentified flying objects sighting incidents, providing details about the observation made on March 8th, 1948.
sighted object: two objects falling to earth with one appearing to be on fire with red and black smoke trailing
witnesses: male civilian employee of the Pacific General Electric Company
